intro: Cyphostemma junceum, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in rocky or arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a notable species in its native habitat.
